Articles.Content:
After many hours of testing I have made a new version of my Shuttle that is now called Endeavour, I know original right. Shuttle can be used to transfer crew but is mainly made for building space stations or launching satellites.

Features:

- Lifting capacity of 6 tons (tested so far)

- Supports 2m parts such as Science module

- Looks like the a real space shuttle

- About 400 parts with no payload

- Space for 3 Kerbals

Action groups:

- 1: toggle booster engine 1

- 2: toggle booster engine 2

- 3: toggle orbital engines

- 4: toggle main shuttle engines

Here are some pictures of the new Space Shuttle.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Flight instruction:

1. Throttle up and press space

2. Depending on the payload use the orbital engines to keep balance, keep a slight angle

3. Coast to 10km

4. Engage gravity turn.

4. When turned keep orbital engines on

5. When needed disable the one of the booster engines.

6. You can separate the booster when you want but it is more efficient if you do, no real specific time for separation. At this point shuttle can fly with or without.

7. Burn at a 60 degree angle until the tank runs out(booster runs out when the upper main shuttle engine shuts down) if so press 4 to shut down all engines

8. You now should have a apoapis of about 90-100km, coast to about 25 sec before your apoapis and circularize.

Disclaimer:

These instructions seem highly complicated and therefore I advice to watch the instruction video.

Video:http://youtu.be/F3vai_Y0uZA

Download Link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/g9u1hcleaur411p/Space%20Shuttle%20Endeavour.craft

Edited December 24, 2013 by Gue__1
New version

Welcome to the forums!

I would like to try out your shuttle, but you didn't post a download link.
I found out about that after i posted that but a new post should be coming. Hold your boosters

Very well done for making it stock with real SRBS and NASA style and making it look decent too XD

Edited December 25, 2013 by montyben101

Testing it now!

Edit: I had some trouble getting past the part where it flips out.

Edited December 21, 2013 by Giggleplex777

That should be when you are almost horizontal, just cut the engines to prevent it and separate the tank.

I hope this helps and btw I check your shuttle and that liquid/solid combo really could make this shuttle more efficient.

I'm going to test that tomorrow and probably make a video too. Lastly can you describe when you get the flip out?

That should be when you are almost horizontal, just cut the engines to prevent it and separate the tank.

I hope this helps and btw I check your shuttle and that liquid/solid combo really could make this shuttle more efficient.

I'm going to test that tomorrow and probably make a video too. Lastly can you describe when you get the flip out?

I'm pretty sure the reason for the flip out was more pilot error on my end.
I have been testing with a solid/liquid booster setup and we might have hit the jackpot, we are going to the Mun
People please let me know what you think suggestions are more then welcome.....

Dear Kod, does that thing actually fly?

It looks really good. Most of my shuttles end up looking really nice but then you realize the ground 5 meters down isn't the best place to put a work of art.

I have updated the thread with my new version of the Shuttle which now has a name.

I'm curious about what your opinions are of this craft.
My opinion: it looks awesome and to actually create a functional shuttle takes a lot of skill. Good job!
Thanks, the only thing I'm afraid of is that not many people will be able to use it because it is over 400 parts....
Awesome job! This thing is beautiful.
Beautiful craft !

What is big reason for spamming spaceport with two pages of this craft?

Makes very negative impression IMO.

Damm, sorry for the spamming. When i uploaded it to spaceport it had a error so I might have spammed the upload bottom out of frustration. Is there any way of deleting them?

Again sorry it was not my intention

Damm, sorry for the spamming. When i uploaded it to spaceport it had a error so I might have spammed the upload bottom out of frustration. Is there any way of deleting them?

Again sorry it was not my intention

it is not possible to delete a post on spaceport without changing the code

Hey Kerbalnauts, I got some awesome work to show you that will soon be coming to the forums.

It has a bigger cargo bay and has just launched a 7.5 ton in a 85km/85km orbit. It also has updated orbital engines that look like the real deal.

You can expect the update late this week if all goes as planned. Feedback is always respected....

Gue
That looks simply amazing.
